thread.title: Swathes of Putney and Fulham brought to standstill by huge biker procession
thread.title_full: Swathes of Putney and Fulham brought to standstill by huge biker procession

author: Patrick Grafton-Green
title: Swathes of Putney and Fulham brought to standstill by huge biker procession
text:
Wolves vs Chelsea: FA Cup preview 
Large parts of south-west London were brought to a standstill on Monday when a huge procession of bikers gathered for the funeral of a father-of-three killed in a crash in Chelsea. 
Tommy McEniry died on January 26 after he was knocked down by a car in King‚Äôs Road while riding a moped to an appointment at Guy‚Äôs Hospital. 
Paramedics battled to save the 31-year-old but he was pronounced dead at the scene. 
On Monday afternoon a procession of bikers brought swathes of Putney and Fulham to a standstill as hundreds of mourners took to the roads from about 2pm. ‚Äî Anne Sommerfield (@AnneSommerfield) February 13, 2017 
Motorists reported traffic chaos in the Putney Bridge and Putney High Street areas, while the bikers were also spotted outside Fulham Broadway. 
Jim Semple said on Twitter: "Well for a few extraordinary minutes, Fulham Broadway turned into the Bikers Wild West!." Well for a few extraordinary minutes, Fulham Broadway turned into the Bikers Wild West! Must have been their annual get togetherüòÑ pic.twitter.com/94cahoz4u6 ‚Äî Jim Semple (@Jim_ThinkBIG) February 13, 2017 
Sophie Rose added: "All the motorbikes at Fulham Broadway just really scared me! What is going on??" 
Becky Pinner said: "Ok it caused traffic chaos in putney but I respect all the bikers who supported the biker who died." 
Ok it caused traffic chaos in putney but I respect all the bikers who supported the biker who died at the #PutneyBridge junctionüèç point made pic.twitter.com/F0A4tNXpSU ‚Äî Becky Pinner (@beckypinner) February 13, 2017 
Milli Taylor said: "Bikers are causing chaos on Putney Bridge. Police can do nothing but watch." Bikers are causing chaos on Putney Bridge. Police can do nothing but watch. #putneybridge pic.twitter.com/MhsvaA6mRX ‚Äî Milli Taylor (@MillisKitchen) February 13, 2017 
Mr McEniry‚Äôs funeral took place at All Saints' Church in Putney Common and Putney Vale Cemetery. 
He was described as a ‚Äúhardworking family man‚Äù by his partner of 11 years Jade Coulson, 27. 
The couple lived in Parsons Green and had three children together Harley, nine, Brooke, five, and Tommie, one. 
Miss Coulson told the Standard: ‚ÄúTommy was amazing. He would literally help anybody.
